page.title: 17Tourism - Two Bridges
page.content:
This area is within the Dartmoor National Park, and every year the demands from the tourist industry increase.
The area mainly attracts ramblers and hikers, as well as day trippers who generally congregate around Two Bridges. The National Park Committee actively encourage the use of the moor for walking by providing guided walks for a modest fee, some of which are general walks, and others which are concerned with special subjects such as map reading or ornithology. Walkers can wander freely over the open moor, as a de facto right of access has existed for many years.
Ponies can be hired at various places, although tend not to be seen on the high moor.
